qas.question: Who is the leader of Estonia's government?
What political structure aids the Prime Minister?
The political scene of Estonia is similar to other countries in what continent?
Who is Europe's longest serving Prime Minister?

context: Estonia is a parliamentary representative democratic republic in which <a0_0>the Prime Minister of Estonia<a0_0/> is the head of government and which includes <a1_0>a multi-party system<a1_0/>. The political culture is stable in Estonia, where power is held between two and three parties that have been in politics for a long time. This situation is similar to other countries in <a2_0>Northern Europe<a2_0/>. The former Prime Minister of Estonia, <a3_0>Andrus Ansip<a3_0/>, is also Europe's longest-serving Prime Minister (from 2005 until 2014). The current Estonian Prime Minister is Taavi Rõivas, who is the former Minister of Social Affairs and the head of the Estonian Reform Party.
